data.title: Search
data.text:
Free Text Search

Search the Accademia site for a combination of words, a name, or a number or letter sequence in the transcriptions of documents.

Personal Name Search

Use the drop-down menu to browse and select a Personal Name. The Personal Name list includes participants in the Accademia di San Luca, witnesses of transactions, and others. Preferred spellings of names appear in boldface type, followed by vernacular and Latin variants. You will find summaries, transcriptions, digitized images of the original documents in which the named person is mentioned. In certain cases searches lead to expanded artistsâ€™ pages, which include not only links to documents but also bibliographies and images of related works.

Place Name Search

Use the drop-down menu to browse and select a Place Name. The Place Name list includes locations where the Accademia di San Luca or its members interacted or transacted business with other individuals and institutions in and outside Rome. Preferred spellings of names appear in boldface type, followed by vernacular and Latin variants. In certain cases searches for locations in Rome lead to expanded place pages including historical entries, bibliographies, early modern images related to the places themselves, and four coeval maps of the city.

Guided Search

In the Guided Search, use the drop-down menus to browse and select a Place Name, Key Term, Type of Document, Notary, or Year. The search parameters you select from the drop-down menus will connect you to all related documents. You will find summaries, transcriptions, and digitized images of the original documents.

Place Name

The Place Name list includes churches, districts, and neighborhoods within Rome; outside Rome it provides the names of cities, countries, and regions.

Key Term

The Key Term list includes offices, titles, professions, and technical and legal vocabulary in the documents.

Type of Document

The Type of Document list provides short descriptive terms that reflects the legal or transactional nature of individual documents.

Notary

The Notary list includes the names of all notaries who recorded the meetings and transactions of the Accademia.

Year

The Year list enables research of the documents by date.
